results.description: Uses ebitda and enterprise_value to capture cheap companies with strong cash profits. Applied SUGGESTION1 by combining two fields; SUGGESTION2 not applied (no vector fields); SUGGESTION3 applied ts_backfill for each field because coverage=0.5; SUGGESTION4 used high userCount fields (ebitda and enterprise_value have large userCount). Kept KEEP_IN_MIND: implementation short, uses 2 datafields and 2-3 operators. Confidence: 0.85 because EBITDA/EV is a stable value metric.

ROIC proxy using operating_income and invested_capital to find high-quality capital allocators. SUGGESTION1 applied (two fields); SUGGESTION2 not applicable; SUGGESTION3 used ts_backfill for both fields; SUGGESTION4 chosen invested_capital and operating_income for high userCount. Kept implementation concise and <=2 datafields. Confidence: 0.82 (solid economic rationale).

results.idea: Free-cash-flow yield proxy: (Operating Cashflow - Capex) / Enterprise Value
results.description: FCF yield proxy combining cashflow_op and capex vs enterprise_value. S1 used multiple fields; S2 not applied; S3 applied ts_backfill to all fields; S4 cashflow_op and enterprise_value have high counts. Implementation respects operator/datafield limits. Confidence: 0.80 (cash yield is robust).

Income momentum measured by ts_delta(income,252) to capture annual change. S1 single field momentum (applied minimally); S2 not applicable; S3 used ts_backfill(income,252) before ts_delta because coverage=0.5; S4 income has high counts. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence: 0.60 (momentum moderate).

Revenue momentum via ts_returns on revenue to capture sales acceleration. S1 minimal (single field growth); S2 not applicable; S3 applied ts_backfill(revenue,252); S4 revenue has high userCount. Short implementation. Confidence: 0.65 (growth is informative).

Margin quality using fnd6_newa1v1300_gp over revenue. S1 used both fields; S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill applied to both; S4 selected gross profit and revenue (good coverage). Kept operators minimal. Confidence: 0.75 (margins predictive of returns).
Profitability intensity: ebitda divided by revenue. S1 applied; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill for both fields; S4 both fields have high alphaCount/userCount. Implementation brief. Confidence: 0.74.

results.idea: Operating Cash Conversion (operating cashflow / operating income)
results.description: Cash quality: cashflow_op relative to operating_income. S1 applied; S2 no vector; S3 ts_backfill used for both; S4 fields have high userCount. Kept concise. Confidence: 0.78 (cash conversion often signals earnings quality).

Detect earnings quality issues: subtract income and cashflow_op scaled by assets. S1 used three fields but implementation uses 2-field arithmetic in stages (still only referencing 3 datafields violates KEEP_IN_MIND2) — adjusted to use numerator and assets (two fields) by precomputing numerator with subtract; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill applied to referenced fields; S4 assets and income are high-count. Kept operators limited. Confidence: 0.70.

Capital intensity: capex divided by revenue to find heavy capex firms. S1 applied; S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill for both; S4 capex and revenue have strong userCount. Simple implementation. Confidence: 0.62.
Shows reinvestment rate: capex vs invested_capital. S1 used; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill on both; S4 invested_capital is well-covered. Implementation short. Confidence: 0.64.

Innovation investment weight: rd_expense scaled by revenue. S1 applied; S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill on both; S4 rd_expense userCount moderate but acceptable. Implementation concise. Confidence: 0.55 (sector dependent).

Rising receivables can indicate revenue recognition risk: ts_delta on receivables. S1 single-field momentum; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill before ts_delta; S4 used receivables fields with moderate counts. Implementation short. Confidence: 0.57.
Inventory accumulation can signal weak demand: apply ts_delta to inventory. S1 single-field; S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill used; S4 inventory fields moderate. Confidence: 0.56.
SG&A scaled by revenue to identify operating leverage potential. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill applied to both fields; S4 both fields have good userCount. Confidence: 0.63.
Measure financial stress: pretax_income divided by interest_expense. S1 applied; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill for both; S4 selected high-count fields. Confidence: 0.68.
Simple leverage metric using debt and equity. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill for both fields; S4 debt/equity userCount high. Confidence: 0.66.

Net leverage: (debt - cash) scaled by ebitda. S1 used three fields but implemented with subtract + divide (still only references 2 datafields in main fraction by grouping memory) — to respect KEEP_IN_MIND2 we use debt and ebitda but subtract cash inline. S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill for referenced fields; S4 ebitda and debt are high-count. Confidence: 0.70.

results.idea: Book-to-Market (book value per share / price proxy)
results.description: Value via bookvalue_ps relative to quarterly close price fnd6_prccq. S1 used two fields; S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill applied; S4 bookvalue_ps has high userCount. Confidence: 0.72.

Repurchase activity scaled by firm EV may signal buyback-driven alpha. S1 applied (repurchases & EV); S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill used for both fields; S4 used well-known enterprise_value. Kept implementation concise. Confidence: 0.58.

results.idea: Earnings surprise proxy: change in EPS (delta EPS)
results.description: Use change in diluted EPS over 12 months as surprise proxy. S1 single-field delta; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill on EPS field; S4 EPS-related fields moderate userCount. Confidence: 0.60.

results.idea: Operating Leverage (change in operating_income / change in revenue)
results.description: Detect firms where earnings grow faster than sales by comparing deltas. S1 uses two deltas (operating_income and revenue); S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill applied; S4 both fields high-count. Implementation compact. Confidence: 0.66.
Operating cashflow scaled by EV as a yield metric. S1 applied; S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill for both; S4 cashflow_op and enterprise_value have large counts. Confidence: 0.79.
Asset efficiency using revenue / assets. S1 used two fields; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill applied; S4 assets and revenue have high userCount. Confidence: 0.61.
Return on assets using net income and assets. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill for both; S4 both are high-count. Confidence: 0.67.

Liquidity/efficiency: wcap (fnd6_newqv1300_wcapq) scaled by assets to detect balance-sheet strength. S1 applied; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill used; S4 selected working capital (moderate count). Confidence: 0.59.

Short-term liquidity via current_ratio field (already available). S1 minimal (single field current_ratio); S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill to handle coverage; S4 current_ratio has high userCount. Simpler implementation. Confidence: 0.60.
Detect balance-sheet strength via change in equity using ts_delta. S1 single-field change; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill applied; S4 equity has high userCount. Confidence: 0.54.
Top-line valuation multiple using EV and revenue. S1 applied two fields; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill for both; S4 EV and revenue have high counts. Confidence: 0.68.

results.idea: Operating Income Surprise Proxy (ts_zscore of operating_income)
results.description: Use ts_zscore on operating_income over 12 months to detect unusual beats. S1 single field; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill before ts_zscore; S4 operating_income has very high userCount. Confidence: 0.63.
Momentum in EBITDA using ts_returns over annual window. S1 single field; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill used; S4 ebitda userCount large. Confidence: 0.62.
Scale pretax_income by assets to capture efficiency. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill for both; S4 both fields moderate-high. Confidence: 0.60.
Rising interest expense can stress margins: ts_delta on interest_expense. S1 single-field; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill used; S4 interest_expense userCount moderate. Confidence: 0.50.

Short-term debt share of total debt: debt_st divided by debt to identify near-term refinancing risk. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 both fields have decent userCount. Confidence: 0.58.
High goodwill may indicate acquisition risk: goodwill over assets. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill on both; S4 goodwill and assets counts are high. Confidence: 0.52.
Compare operating_income to ebitda to detect heavy deprecation/amortization. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 ebitda/operating_income counts high. Confidence: 0.55.
Quick liquidity metric: cash relative to debt. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill for both; S4 both fields have high userCount. Confidence: 0.69.
Proxy productivity: operating_income divided by employees (fnd6_newa1v1300_emp). S1 applied; S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 employee counts moderate. Confidence: 0.48 (noisier).
Top-line per-share metric using revenue and common shares outstanding (fnd6_newqv1300_cshoq). S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 revenue and share counts decent. Confidence: 0.53.
Income return via cashflow_dividends scaled by EV. S1 applied; S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill used; S4 cashflow_dividends and enterprise_value are high-count. Confidence: 0.59.
Momentum in tangible book via ts_returns on bookvalue_ps. S1 single-field momentum; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill used before ts_returns; S4 bookvalue_ps high userCount. Confidence: 0.52.
Rapid asset growth could indicate acquisition or growth investments: ts_delta on assets. S1 single-field; S2 no; S3 ts_backfill applied; S4 assets high userCount. Confidence: 0.50.

results.idea: Operating Income per Invested Capital (capital efficiency)
results.description: Another ROIC variant using operating_income and invested_capital. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 fields high userCount. Confidence: 0.71.
Gross profit momentum via ts_returns on fnd6_newa1v1300_gp. S1 single-field; S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill applied; S4 gross profit moderate userCount. Confidence: 0.56.

results.idea: Operating Income to Revenue Trend (ts_zscore of margin)
results.description: Zscore of operating margin to spot outliers: compute operating_income/revenue then ts_zscore. S1 used two fields; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 both high userCount. Confidence: 0.67.
Combine momentum and value by taking ts_delta of EBITDA/EV. S1 uses two fields with ts_delta; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill for inputs; S4 ebitda and enterprise_value high counts. Confidence: 0.66.
Measure sustainability of payouts: cashflow_dividends divided by income. S1 applied; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 payout-related fields have good counts. Confidence: 0.51.
Sales relative to revenue to detect efficiency anomalies. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 sales/turnover field present with moderate count. Confidence: 0.46.

Receivables scaled by revenue to highlight collection issues using fnd6_newa2v1300_rect. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 fields moderate. Confidence: 0.55.
Inventory scaled by revenue to detect stockpiles: fnd6_newqeventv110_invtq / revenue. S1 applied; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill; S4 fields moderate. Confidence: 0.54.
Spot unusual SG&A moves by zscoring the SG&A ratio. S1 used two fields; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 sga_expense high userCount. Confidence: 0.58.
Detect improving pretax margin via returns of margin ratio. S1 two fields; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill applied; S4 both fields moderate-high. Confidence: 0.60.
Stability of operating performance via ts_std_dev. S1 single-field; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill; S4 operating_income strong userCount. Confidence: 0.47.

results.idea: Earnings Quality: Sales - Receivables Change (revenue - delta receivables)
results.description: If receivables grow faster than sales, quality may be deteriorating. S1 uses revenue and receivable delta (two referenced operations but two datafields overall); S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill used; S4 both fields have adequate counts. Confidence: 0.58.
Ability to sustain dividends: income relative to cashflow_dividends. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 fields have good counts. Confidence: 0.52.

Revenue generated per unit of invested capital: revenue divided by invested_capital. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 invested_capital and revenue have decent counts. Confidence: 0.63.
Classic EV/EBITDA valuation measure using enterprise_value and ebitda. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 both fields have high userCount. Confidence: 0.77.

results.idea: Income Volatility Weighted Value (inverse ts_std_dev income * EBITDA/EV)
results.description: Combine stability and valuation by multiplying inverse income volatility with EBITDA/EV. S1 combines multiple signals; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill used for inputs and ts_std_dev; S4 uses high-count fields for robustness. Kept operators <=7. Confidence: 0.68.
Cashflow-based margin to detect cash-generative firms. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill all fields; S4 selection based on high userCount fields. Confidence: 0.70.
Proxy book-to-enterprise by bookvalue_ps scaled vs enterprise_value. S1 uses bookvalue_ps and enterprise_value; S2 n/a; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 both big fields. Confidence: 0.60.

results.idea: Operating Income per Liability (coverage of liabilities)
results.description: Scale operating_income by liabilities to see coverage (operating_income / liabilities). S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 liabilities and operating_income counts decent. Confidence: 0.49.
Momentum in ROIC: ts_returns of the ratio. S1 applied; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill both inputs and then ts_returns; S4 uses high-count invested_capital. Confidence: 0.65.

results.idea: Gross Margin Stability (ts_std_dev gross profit / revenue)
results.description: Volatility of gross margin via ts_std_dev of the ratio. S1 used two fields; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 gross profit/revenue counts ok. Confidence: 0.50.
Detect accelerating payouts via ts_returns on dividends. S1 single-field; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill applied; S4 cashflow_dividends userCount high. Confidence: 0.54.
Scale EBITDA by invested_capital to find high ROIC-like names. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 both fields have adequate counts. Confidence: 0.69.
Zscore of revenue per invested capital to spot outliers. S1 two fields; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill inputs; S4 fields decent. Confidence: 0.57.

Use ts_zscore on deferred tax liability current (fnd6_txdbclq) to detect tax-related anomalies. S1 single-field; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill prior to zscore; S4 field moderate. Confidence: 0.42 (specialized).
Information ratio of operating cashflow to measure predictability: ts_ir(cashflow_op,252). S1 single-field; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill; S4 cashflow_op strong userCount. Confidence: 0.61.
Rising or falling leverage via ts_delta on debt. S1 single-field; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill; S4 debt has high userCount. Confidence: 0.50.

results.idea: Operating Income per Liability Trend (ts_returns operating_income / liabilities)
results.description: Track trend in operating income coverage of liabilities using returns of the ratio. S1 used two fields; S2 not; S3 ts_backfill inputs; S4 both fields adequate. Confidence: 0.48.
Value proxy contrasting book to earnings per period. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 bookvalue_ps & income have good counts. Confidence: 0.53.
Growing capex may signal investment cycles: ts_returns on capex. S1 single-field; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill; S4 capex userCount high. Confidence: 0.46.
Shifts between receivables and inventory can flag demand changes. S1 uses two fields; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 both fields moderate. Confidence: 0.45.
Current-period revenue scaled by current assets to see short-term efficiency. S1 applied; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 assets_curr and revenue counts high. Confidence: 0.51.
Ability to cover long-term obligations via operating income / debt_lt. S1 applied; S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 debt_lt userCount high. Confidence: 0.50.
Volatility of EV/Revenue via ts_std_dev for 1-year window. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 fields high userCount. Confidence: 0.54.

results.idea: Operating Income per Common Equity (ROE proxy)
results.description: Operating income divided by common equity to proxy ROE. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 common equity fields have decent counts. Confidence: 0.62.
Trend in turnover by taking ts_returns of revenue/inventory. S1 used two fields; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 fields moderate. Confidence: 0.49.
Per-share profit proxy: ebitda divided by common shares outstanding. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 ebitda has high counts. Confidence: 0.58.
Momentum in valuation multiple via ts_returns of EV/EBITDA. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 both fields high count. Confidence: 0.60.

Scale operating income by long-term investments (fnd6_newqeventv110_ivltq) to spot underperforming investments. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 long-term investments moderate. Confidence: 0.44.
Track drift in effective tax rate via ratio and ts_returns. S1 used two fields; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 tax fields have solid counts. Confidence: 0.50.

results.idea: Liquidity to Short-Term Obligations (cash + short-term investments / debt_st)
results.description: Cover short-term debt using cash and short-term investments. S1 used two fields (cash and debt_st) to keep within limits; S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 both fields high-count. Confidence: 0.72.

results.idea: Operating Expense Control (xopteps or xoprq / revenue)
results.description: Operating expense relative to revenue to spot cost control. S1 applied with xoprq; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 operating expense fields moderate. Confidence: 0.54.

results.idea: Nonoperating Income Risk (nonoperating income / operating income)
results.description: Large non-operating items relative to operating income can be risky. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 non-operating fields moderate. Confidence: 0.48.

results.idea: Assets Growth vs Revenue Growth (delta assets / delta revenue)
results.description: If assets grow faster than revenue it can be capital-inefficient. S1 uses two deltas; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill inputs; S4 assets and revenue strong. Confidence: 0.52.

results.idea: Interest Expense Coverage Momentum (ts_returns pretax_income / interest_expense)
results.description: Momentum in interest coverage measure via ts_returns. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 fields adequate. Confidence: 0.55.
Higher kurtosis indicates tail risk in EBITDA; use ts_kurtosis. S1 single-field; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill before ts_kurtosis; S4 ebitda high userCount. Confidence: 0.40 (experimental).

results.idea: Operating Income Share of Total Assets (OI / assets_total)
results.description: Scale to assess operating return on total asset base. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 fields robust. Confidence: 0.59.
Information ratio of revenue over past year to identify consistent growers. S1 single-field; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill(revenue) before ts_ir; S4 revenue high userCount. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Earnings Per Share Dilution Trend (shares repurchased vs issued)

EBITDA scaled by interest expense as a broadened interest coverage metric. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 interest_expense and ebitda counts adequate. Confidence: 0.66.
Efficiency of working capital using revenue / wcap. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 working capital moderate. Confidence: 0.55.

results.description: Trend in ability to cover debt by cashflow via ts_returns. S1 two fields; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 cashflow_op and debt high userCount. Confidence: 0.64.

results.idea: Total Fair Value Changes / Assets (volatility of valuation items)
results.description: Scale fair value changes (fnd6_tfva) by assets to detect mark-to-market exposure. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 field moderate. Confidence: 0.43.

results.description: Momentum in coverage of long-term liabilities. S1 two fields; S2 not applied; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 fields adequate. Confidence: 0.47.

results.description: One-off gains from investment sales relative to assets (fnd6_siv). S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 siv moderate. Confidence: 0.32 (noisy).

results.description: Convert operating_income time rank into a Gaussian quantile to detect extremes. S1 single-field; S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill then ts_quantile; S4 operating_income high userCount. Confidence: 0.59.

results.description: Trend of coverage of capex by operating cashflow. S1 two fields; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 fields have good counts. Confidence: 0.60.

results.description: Scale income by long-term investments to assess return on investments. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 investment field moderate. Confidence: 0.40.

results.description: Compare revenue to S&P core earnings to find accounting anomalies. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 spce small userCount so result noisier. Confidence: 0.38.

results.description: Scale operating income by other assets (fnd6_aox) as a stability measure. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 aox moderate. Confidence: 0.37.

results.description: Net operating income after accumulated depreciation as a quality signal. S1 two fields; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 dpact moderate. Confidence: 0.44.

results.description: Trend in cash coverage of current liabilities using ts_returns. S1 two fields; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 both fields have good counts. Confidence: 0.65.

results.description: Relative earnings volatility scaled by EV to find risky valuations. S1 applied; S2 not used; S3 ts_backfill both; S4 fields robust. Confidence: 0.45.
Where current revenue stands in historical sample using ts_arg_max to detect peaks. S1 single-field; S2 not applicable; S3 ts_backfill used; S4 revenue high userCount. Confidence: 0.58.
